jitobear

Last night I was hanging out with about 7 guys. All musicians, all with other jobs, businesses, nice, responsible, pay-their-bills guys ranging in age from 33 to 45.
 
 The conversation as they loaded up their gear focused on - motorcycles, rock and roll, pizza, Family Guy, Futurama and apparently THE FUNNIEST THINGS EVER are burps and farts. On the drive home there was a serious discussion about breakfast cereals.
 
 I love these guys - really I do, but I swear the only difference between them and my 11 year old son and his friends is the amount of facial hair.
 
 :)

post_info.post_title: How to to know the men from the boys

Ooaman

Last night I was hanging out with about 7 guys. All musicians, all with other jobs, businesses, nice, responsible, pay-their-bills guys ranging in age from 33 to 45.
 
 The conversation as they loaded up their gear focused on - motorcycles, rock and roll, pizza, Family Guy, Futurama and apparently THE FUNNIEST THINGS EVER are burps and farts. On the drive home there was a serious discussion about breakfast cereals.
 
 I love these guys - really I do, but I swear the only difference between them and my 11 year old son and his friends is the amount of facial hair.
 
 :)

 It sounds to me like your buddies or really just desperate for either attention or a good laugh. In the mean time, they are going for what they can get. If you were to ask me, fart jokes loose their humor at age 2. I remember going to see a movie called Master Of Disguise, mainly because Brent Spiner played the villain. I prefer him as Data on Star Trek TNG, but he was the villain in this movie. In the end, the day was saved because he farted too much. Why? I don't get fart jokes. It's funny like once at most. After that, it's not funny anymore. Out of curiosity, why do people (kids or whoever) find a fart funny? Am I missing something when it comes to farts? Wait, were your friends drunk at the time?
jitobear

It sounds to me like your buddies or really just desperate for either attention or a good laugh. In the mean time, they are going for what they can get. I prefer him as Data on Star Trek TNG, but he was the villain in this movie. In the end, the day was saved because he farted too much. Why? I don't get fart jokes. It's funny like once at most. After that, it's not funny anymore. Out of curiosity, why do people (kids or whoever) find a fart funny? Am I missing something when it comes to farts? Wait, were your friends drunk at the time?

 
 Ya they were tad drunk and they are always up for silly, especially when tired after a show. They are truly smart, well put together guys. They just made me laugh. The whole thing was just a rather amusing anecdoate that I thought I would share. :)

Hey the more things in life that amuse you the better. We don't laugh enough.

If this is the average man you are used to associating with, I can understand your distain for men in general.
 
 The fact that a bunch of guys that you hang out with are childish XXXXXX certainly does not mean that all are. It just means that you prefer the company of childish XXXXXX.

 
 They aren't childish XXXXXX. They are great guys and the reason I actually still love many men. It was just meant to be a funny story about a silly moment. At least they aren't boring snobs. If that were the case I might actually have a TRUE disdain for men.
daewoo

They aren't childish XXXXXX. They are great guys and the reason I actually still love many men. It was just meant to be a funny story about a silly moment. At least they aren't boring snobs. If that were the case I might actually have a TRUE disdain for men.

 
 Hmmm....who said this:
 
 
I love these guys - really I do, but I swear the only difference between them and my 11 year old son and his friends is the amount of facial hair.

 
 
 Now they are not childish?
 
 Honestly, if this is the kind of people you enjoy hanging out with, it explains a LOT.
jitobear

Honestly, if this is the kind of people you enjoy hanging out with, it explains a LOT.

 
 And what kind of people would that be? You don't even know them. I can't believe you have utilized this as an opportunity to insult me and my friends. Are you usually this pathetic?
 
 But you what, you are right. Hanging with guys this absolutely and amazingly talented, sweet and fun explains a lot. It speaks to my love of people, music - and to my sense of humor. It explains how I can go into the FUN FORUM and tell a silly story just for giggles.
 
 Are your acqaintances responsible for you being a total buzz-kill? I bet you are just a riot at parties.
daewoo

And what kind of people would that be? You don't even know them. I can't believe you have utilized this as an opportunity to insult me and my friends. Are you usually this pathetic?

 
 What kind of people? Don't really know. I can only go by your description:
 
 
I love these guys - really I do, but I swear the only difference between them and my 11 year old son and his friends is the amount of facial hair.

 
 By that description, I would say "childish XXXXXX". 
 
 
But you what, you are right. Hanging with guys this absolutely and amazingly talented, sweet and fun explains a lot. It speaks to my love of people, music - and to my sense of humor. It explains how I can go into the FUN FORUM and tell a silly story just for giggles.

 
 It also explains in part your low view of men in general. If this was the kind of guys I ran around with, I woudl have a pretty dim view of the male half of the human race as well. 
 
 
Are your acqaintances responsible for you being a total buzz-kill? I bet you are just a riot at parties.

 
 I would imagine that we go to different types of parties. Fart jokes and serious discussions regarding animated television shows, breakfast cereals, and burping is not generally encouraged. It is that whole "grown up" thing.
jitobear

What kind of people? Don't really know. I can only go by your description:
 
 By that description, I would say "childish XXXXXX". 

 
 It was a recounting of one silly hour, late at night in the life of me and my friends. I put it in here because the whole thing made me smile all day the next day and I thought I would share. The fact that you have felt compelled to jump on it so mean-spiritededly and insultingly speakes volumes about YOU. Especially since I stuck it in the FUN FORUM. (Do you have fun, like, ever? When is the last time you smiled? Giggled?)
 
 
It also explains in part your low view of men in general. If this was the kind of guys I ran around with, I woudl have a pretty dim view of the male half of the human race as well. 

 
 I know this will be hard, but please try to remove yourself from the center of the universe for a moment: don't mistake how you feel about a matter with how I do. What you and I hold in high estimation are no where near the same. These guys are honest, hard-working, open-hearted and occasionally joyful and silly. They renew my faith in mankind. I can not say the same for snotty, self important, yuppies.
 
 And just what is my view of guys, by the way? Any issues I have with men result from an abusive marriage and a lousy father. It's these fun, loving, sweet, good-natured men who are in my life who have made me NOT give up on men entirely.
 
 
I would imagine that we go to different types of parties. Fart jokes and serious discussions regarding animated television shows, breakfast cereals, and burping is not generally encouraged. It is that whole "grown up" thing.

 
 It's a pity if your life leaves no room for silly. Sounds awful dreary. I feel sorry for you.
C. Langana

Gentlemen please, because the man enjoys time with his friends and wanted to tell us about it is poor reason to attack both he and his associates.
 
 Secondly there is no reason to assume that men acting immaturely necessarily precludes intelligence, perhaps their humour is coarse but really there are few joys greater than as is known colloquialy here 'Having a laugh with some mate's,'
 I for one have known evenings to flit from a conversation about thermodynamics to 'Hold my beer and watch this...' very easily.
jitobear

Gentlemen please, because the man enjoys time with his friends and wanted to tell us about it is poor reason to attack both he and his associates.
 
 Secondly there is no reason to assume that men acting immaturely necessarily precludes intelligence, perhaps their humour is coarse but really there are few joys greater than as is known colloquialy here 'Having a laugh with some mate's,'
 I for one have known evenings to flit from a conversation about thermodynamics to 'Hold my beer and watch this...' very easily.

 
 Amen to that brutha...
 
 However - jitobear is a she. :)

C. Langana

Jitobear: Ahem, um, Oops... sorry, no offense taken I hope. 
 
 Ooaman: fair enough, coarse humour is not to everyone's taste, though as far as I'm concerned anything can be funny if done well. It's just bodily functions are an extremely cheap gag.
jitobear

Jitobear: Ahem, um, Oops... sorry, no offense taken I hope. 
 
 Ooaman: fair enough, coarse humour is not to everyone's taste, though as far as I'm concerned anything can be funny if done well. It's just bodily functions are an extremely cheap gag.

 
 Very cheap. But at 3am, a couple of beers in, hauling heavy equipment, and exhausted - cheap is good and everything is funnneeeey.
 
 C. Langana - no offense taken.
daewoo

It was a recounting of one silly hour, late at night in the life of me and my friends. I put it in here because the whole thing made me smile all day the next day and I thought I would share. The fact that you have felt compelled to jump on it so mean-spiritededly and insultingly speakes volumes about YOU. Especially since I stuck it in the FUN FORUM. (Do you have fun, like, ever? When is the last time you smiled? Giggled?)

 
 The problem reveals itself. There is no FUN FORUM. There is a FUN DEBATES forum. I assumed you wanted to debate some aspect of this. Given the title of the thread, and the story, I assumed that what you were after was a debate abotu whether this constituted immature idiocy or not. 
 
 There is an "open forum" for chit chat. I assume that "silly stories" would fit in there.
 
 
 
I know this will be hard, but please try to remove yourself from the center of the universe for a moment: don't mistake how you feel about a matter with how I do. What you and I hold in high estimation are no where near the same. These guys are honest, hard-working, open-hearted and occasionally joyful and silly. They renew my faith in mankind. I can not say the same for snotty, self important, yuppies.

 
 It cracks me up every time you accuse somebody else fo thinking they are the center of the universe. As I have said before, you need to take things less personally. I don't care about you, your kids, your day care arrangements, your job, or your infantile friends. You could all die horribly tomorrow, or live forever. It makes no difference to me. I simply do not care.
 
 IF you are going to post things in a "debate" forum, expect them to be debated. If you DONT want to debate something, find a forum without the word DEBATE in the title. Maybe the admin could put up a special forum for you...Silly and irrelevant stories. Then people would know you do not wish to debate, you are just bloviating.
jitobear

The problem reveals itself. There is no FUN FORUM. There is a FUN DEBATES forum. 

 
 The subtitle under "Fun Debates" is "Silly, pointless, meaningless discussions" so it seemed an appropriate place. Sorry I did not categorize well enough for you. 
 
 
It cracks me up every time you accuse somebody else fo thinking they are the center of the universe.

 
 I was not aware I called anyone else that. You were the one assuming that because YOU view people who are occasionally silly with disdain that we all (me included) must also view them as such and therefore that the reason I have any problems with men is them. It was total projection on your part.
 
 
As I have said before, you need to take things less personally. I don't care about you, your kids, your day care arrangements, your job, or your infantile friends. You could all die horribly tomorrow, or live forever. It makes no difference to me. I simply do not care.

 
 At least we are of one mind on this. I could not care less about you, your overtly controlled soon to be spoiled children, your business that takes up all your time (and apparently good humor) or your uptight superficial boring friends. 
 
 Oh - don't take any of that personally... emoticon_cool
daewoo

The subtitle under "Fun Debates" is "Silly, pointless, meaningless discussions" so it seemed an appropriate place. Sorry I did not categorize well enough for you, Daewoo. 
 
 At least we are of one mind on thing. I could not care less about you, your overtly controlled soon to be spoiled children, your business that takes up all your time (and apparently good humor) or your uptight superficial boring friends. 
 
 Oh - don't mind any of that, I didn't mean anything personal... emoticon_cool

 
 
 Hmmmm. Maybe you missed it. I am retired now. Nothing takes up all my time now. Some days I don't even get out of bed until 8:00 or 9:00. 
 
 As far as the kids go, they are 3, 1 and soon to be born, and they are anything but spoiled. They will have to learn about life and getting things that you want the same way I did....by working for them. My 3 yr old is pretty sure that we all work for her, but I am told that is just the way 3 yr old girls tend to be...they really think they are in charge.
 
 You can say what you like about my life and the choices I made, but I think things turned out pretty well. I got to retire early enough to enjoy my family, and live the majority of my life as I please as opposed to working my entire life and then suffering through a budgeted retirement in my golden years before I get shuffled off to a nursing home. It took a lot of years of hard work, unwavering dedication, a few risks, and a lot of self control, but I am a better man for it, my kids will be better for it, and I have all the time I could possibly want to enjoy my wifes company. 
 
 Superficial and boring friends? Hardly. I will explain it to you the saem way I explain to my 3 yr old why daddy doesn't want to have fun going down the slide. Daddy still likes to have fun, but it is GROWN UP fun.
Ooaman

jitobear, I think I may have narrowed down my point of view. You titled the thread...
How to to know the men from the boys
Then combine that with your story, and it sounds like you do have a debate on your hands with men that want to say that not all men are like that and boys who would want to say that they are more mature than that. If I started a thread called...
How to know the women from the girls
 and then follow that up with a story like yours and have it read like I think all women act like little girls, would there be a problem? I'm not saying that you said that all men act like boys. But based upon where this thread has gone, it reads like that was the point you were trying to make. Now, let's say that you titled the thread something like...
A funny anecdote
then, you could have given your story and other posters could give their own personal funny stories or what ever. Out of curiosity, did you particularly want this thread to go anywhere or did you just want to tell your story and then you didn't care where it went?
daewoo

Based on past experience with Jitobear, that is EXACTLY what this thread was meant to imply. Then when it became evident that nobody was seeing things that way, and instead people were simply seeing the story as an example of the low quality of man she was running around with, she tried to wriggle out of it. 
 
 Maybe I am wrong. It has happened before. The year was 1987.......
jitobear

then, you could have given your story and other posters could give their own personal funny stories or what ever. Out of curiosity, did you particularly want this thread to go anywhere or did you just want to tell your story and then you didn't care where it went?

 
 Yes, that was my intention. It was honestly just meant to be a funny story and maybe other folks could share the like. And I sincerely apologize if that wasn't clear in the initial post. However, I would have hoped when I said the following in my second post it would have cleared things up. Apparently there are some people who can't read plain English (not you Ooaman - your concerns with my post have at least not been insulting or arrogant).
 
 
Ya they were tad drunk and they are always up for silly, especially when tired after a show. They are truly smart, well put together guys. They just made me laugh. The whole thing was just a rather amusing anecdoate that I thought I would share.

 
 
Based on past experience with Jitobear, that is EXACTLY what this thread was meant to imply. Then when it became evident that nobody was seeing things that way, and instead people were simply seeing the story as an example of the low quality of man she was running around with, she tried to wriggle out of it.

 
 Jack-XXX. Quit insulting me and my friends. They are ten times the man you are. For starters - they aren't mean. Secondly - they don't get off insulting total strangers they don't know anything about. In my opinion the only low calibre man I have had to put up with the last couple of days is YOU.
daewoo

Jack-XXX. Quit insulting me and my friends. They are ten times the man you are. For starters - they aren't mean. Secondly - they don't get off insulting total strangers they don't know anything about. In my opinion the only low calibre man I have had to put up with the last couple of days is YOU.

 
 YOU are the one who posted their childidsh antics, in a debate forum, for review. Getting upset when another poster paints them as childish and immature is inappropriate, especially when you do it yourself in the very first post.
jitobear

YOU are the one who posted their childidsh antics, in a debate forum, for review. Getting upset when another poster paints them as childish and immature is inappropriate, especially when you do it yourself in the very first post.

 
 I may not have minded an initial questioning post (such as Ooman's) - but I have clarified my intent and their character to you now about half a dozen times and you continue to insult them and as well as me. Oh wait a minute - I made that clarification before you posted a thing. 
 
 Let me try this one more time.
 
 1) It was meant to be a silly story about one hour and I posted it because the whole thing made me smile and I thought I would share. 
 
 2) These guys rock my world in every sense of the word. They are smart, fun, talented, sweet guys. They are my friends. They rule. They are awesome. They are amazing. They are sincere. They bring me joy. They are the best. 
 
 They are not childish indiots. They are not responsible for anything negative in my life.
 
 I do not place value on superficial actions. I look at the heart of intent. Comparing the intent of bunch guys goofing off in a silly way vs. yours the past couple days in the forum - it's clear and sparkly as a diamond to me who has real class, adn who is really childish.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  How to to know the men from the boys
